name: Disposition of real property
text: [§110-4]  Disposition of real property.  Any state-owned cemetery, or any part thereof, which is cleared of the remains of deceased persons and is no longer needed as a cemetery shall be offered to the county in which the cemetery is located for use as a public park.  If the county does not accept the vacated property for use as a public park, the property shall be transferred to the control of the department of land and natural resources for disposition in accordance with applicable law. [L 1987, c 368, pt of §2]
